quotes.quote: The creatures outside looked from pig to man, and from man to pig , and from pig to man again: but already it was impossible to say which was which. -George Orwell
Another world is not only possible, she is on her way. On a quiet day, I can hear her breathing. -Arundhati Roy
There is nothing to writing. All you have to do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed. -Ernest Hemingway
That's what careless words do, they make people love you a little less. -Arundhati Roy
I wondered if that's how forgiveness budded, not with the fanfare of epiphany, but with pain gathering it's things, packing up, and slipping away unannounced in the middle of night . -Khaled Hosseini
The best books are those that tell you what you know already. -George Orwell
The way her body existed only where he touched her. The rest of her was smoke. -Arundhati Roy
If you're happy in a dream, does that count? -Arundhati Roy
This was the trouble with families. Like invidious doctors, they knew just where to hurt. -Arundhati Roy
And the air was full of thoughts and words to say. But at times like these, only small things are ever said. Big things lurk unsaid inside. -Arundhati Roy
There are things you can't do - like writing letters to a part of yourself. To your feet or hair. Or heart. -Arundhati Roy
Existence is a series of footnotes to a vast obscure, unfinished masterpiece. -Vladimir Nabokov
We accept the love we think we deserve. -Stephen Chbosky

She was the third beer. Not the first one, which the throat receives with almost tearful gratitude; nor the second, that confirms and extends the pleasure of the first. But the third, the one you drink because it's there, because it can't hurt, and because what difference does it make? -Toni Morrison
But if thought corrupts language, language also corrupts thought. -George Orwell
The choice for mankind lies between freedom and happiness and for the great bulk of mankind, happiness is better. -George Orwell
One does not establish a dictatorship in order to safeguard a revolution; One makes the revolution in order to establish the dictatorship. -George Orwell
Until I feared I would lose it, I never loved to read. One does not love breathing. -Harper Lee
Hating you shall be a game played with cool hands. -Gwendolyn Bennet
The moment passed in a heartbeat. But it did not matter. What mattered was it existed. -Arundhati Roy
Addiction has its own mnemonics - skin, smell, the length of of the loved one's finger. -Arundhati Roy
Who can know from the word goodbye what kind of parting is in store for us. -Arundhati Roy
I think there's just one kind of folks. Folks. -Harper Lee
But you know, happiness can be found even in the darkest of times, if only one remembers to turn on the light. - J.K. Rowling
Words are, in my not-so-humble opinion, our most inexhaustible source of magic. -J.K. Rowling
"After all this time?". "Always," said Snape. -J.K. Rowling
Calvin: You know, Hobbes, some days even my lucky rocket ship underpants don't help. -Bill Watterson
There's never enough time to do all the nothing you want. -Bill Watterson
Though lovers be lost, love shall not; And death shall have no dominion. -Dylan Thomas
Listen up - there's no war that will end all wars. -Haruki Murakami
But who prays for Satan? Who in eighteen centuries, has had the common humanity to pray for the one sinner that needed it the most. -Mark Twain
Introduce a little anarchy, upset the established order, and everything becomes chaos, and you know the thing about chaos? It's fair. -Joker
In a closed society where everybody is guilty, the only crime is getting caught. In a world of thieves, the only final sin is stupidity. -Hunter S. Thompson
That it really began in the days when the love laws were made. The laws that lay down who should be loved, and how. And how much. -Arundhati Roy
Sometimes things aren't meant to be, sometimes they occur to keep the soul in you burning forever.
Reading is a conversation. All books talk. But a good book listens as well. - Mark Haddon
I just hope that one day - preferably when we're both blind drunk - we can talk about it. - J.D. Salinger
The world isn't fair, Calvin. I know dad, but why isn't it ever unfair in  my favour? - Bill Watterson
